reviews.review_msg: Boring and you didn't really need to know much SAS to do well. If you're looking for an easy class this is the one though

Jack Davis is the best prof in SFU STAT department, kind and funny, easygoing. Stat is not a easy class but he make it really interesting to everyone. Exam is soooooooooooooooo easy and I think the class avg will be B or B+ at least. I love u Jack.

recently in January semester, almost 20 ppl in the class drop out from Stat 342 and another 20 ppl failed the class. He pretty much expect everyone in the class to be A+ students and able to follow his pace as an introductory course for STAT's program SAS. He is good in teaching, unfortunately, i aint the A  type student in class

Dr. Shi is the best prof I have seen in SFU. He is always available to help. I sent him a question regarding the final project at 10 pm and he replied to me in 20 min. Some prof may just ignore your email... I would say his course has a medium difficulty. If you review the course material weekly, you will get an A-range grade for sure.
Haolun understands the stress other courses put on the students and makes sure this 2-credit course doesn't add to that.
Seems to be a quite nice new prof. He has been posting slides and videos on time. Midterm is easy and straightforward.
